repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
Dunno why this consistently happens only on Windows: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/21770029074/job/62816978757#step:7:10661

```
FAILED   test/functional/terminal/window_spec.lua @ 426: :terminal window updates terminal size
test/functional\terminal\window_spec.lua:469: Row 1 did not match.
Expected:
  |*rows: 5, cols: 25        â”‚tty ready               |
  |*rows: 5, cols: 50        â”‚rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |*rows: 2, cols: 50        â”‚rows: 5, cols: 50       |
  |*rows: 5, cols: 25        â”‚rows: 2, cols: 50       |
  |*^                         â”‚rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |{17:foo [-]                   }{18:foo [-]                 }|
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
Actual:
  |*rows: 2, cols: 50        â”‚rows: 2, cols: 50       |
  |*rows: 5, cols: 25        â”‚rows: 5, cols: 25       |
  |*^                         â”‚                        |
  |*                         â”‚                        |
  |*                         â”‚                        |
  |{17:foo [-]                   }{18:foo [-]                 }|
  |{3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
```

---

Also, the test from #37159 seems to be flaking occasionally on Windows: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/21785075626/job/62855122707#step:7:10662 ðŸ˜”

```
FAILED   test/functional/terminal/window_spec.lua @ 38: :terminal window resets horizontal scroll on resize #35331
test/functional\terminal\window_spec.lua:69: Row 1 did not match.
Expected:
  |*interact $ AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAâ”‚$ AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA^A|
  |*AAAAAAAAAAAA                 â”‚AAA                 |
  |                             â”‚                    |
  |                             â”‚                    |
  |                             â”‚                    |
  |{119:1000                          }{120:1002                }|
  |                                                  |
Actual:
  |*AAAAAAAA                     â”‚AAAA      ^          |
  |*                             â”‚                    |
  |                             â”‚                    |
  |                             â”‚                    |
  |                             â”‚                    |
  |{119:1000                          }{120:1002                }|
  |                                                  |
```
Might be nice if `bufref_valid()` always returned `false` if `br_buf` is `NULL`. (that's not currently the case if `buf_free_count` didn't change)

`unblock_autocmds()`, like Vim, can run the `TermResponse` that was blocked by `block_autocmds()`...
I presume that can cause trouble in lots of places.

Maybe if autocommands are blocked, `aucmd_defer()` could be attempted instead?
Not "occasionally". It's failing nearly all the time :(

RIP. Any idea why? I've no clue.
Wouldn't mind skipping it for Windows in that case. :pensive:
I don't have time to figure out right now...
No worries. For now, I'll add a skip for Windows in a bit. :+1:
yeah I was hoping for that, but I guess `aucmd_defer` could happen too late for the `Esp. useful when executing a shell command during startup (nvim -d)` scenario mentioned in `unblock_autocmds` ? :(
Yeah, that'll need to be looked into. ðŸ¥² May need to manually run the queue in more (safe) places, I guess.

> May need to manually run the queue in more (safe) places, I guess.

That's a good idea. The more places we can use `aucmd_defer`, the better. Eliminates this special handling everywhere.
